P.title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be directly related to the utilization, research, or technology development of dark matter and must represent a new sector of the economy not previously existing. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by at least one of the following: 
- Official announcement from a major economic or scientific institution. 
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

para_P.title: By 2030, will the discovery of dark matter give rise to new economic sectors?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has resulted in the creation of new economic sectors. These sectors must be directly associated with the use, research, or technological advancement of dark matter and must represent a novel segment of the economy that did not previously exist. The creation of such sectors must be verified by at least one of the following: 
- An official announcement from a major economic or scientific body. 
- Coverage in at least three reputable news outlets (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter believed to make up approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic sectors" refers to areas or fields of economic activity that are newly established and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic framework.

- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

verification_result.reasoning: Both questions inquire about the potential for the discovery of dark matter to lead to the creation of new economic sectors or industries by the year 2030. They specify similar criteria for verification, including official announcements, reputable news coverage, and peer-reviewed publications. The terms "new economic industries" and "new economic sectors" are used interchangeably and refer to the same concept of novel economic activities arising from dark matter research and utilization. Therefore, the essential inquiry is the same, focusing on the economic impact of dark matter discovery by 2030.

P.title: Will Spain introduce a new policy to regulate the operation of electric vehicle companies like Tesla by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Spain has officially introduced a new policy or set of regulations specifically aimed at governing the operation of electric vehicle (EV) companies, including but not limited to Tesla, within its jurisdiction. The policy must address at least one of the following areas: vehicle sales, charging infrastructure, environmental standards, or operational licensing for EV companies. The introduction of such a policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. In the event of a regional policy (e.g., limited to specific autonomous communities or cities) that is intended for national adoption, the question will resolve as Yes. Policies that are part of broader EU directives but specifically implemented by Spain also count towards this question's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Spain implement a new regulation for electric vehicle companies like Tesla by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Spain has officially implemented a new regulation or set of rules specifically targeting the operation of electric vehicle (EV) companies, including but not limited to Tesla, within its territory. The regulation must cover at least one of the following areas: vehicle sales, charging infrastructure, environmental standards, or operational licensing for EV companies. The implementation of such a regulation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The regulation must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. In the event of a regional regulation (e.g., limited to specific autonomous communities or cities) that is intended for national adoption, the question will be answered with Yes. Regulations that are part of broader EU directives but specifically implemented by Spain also count towards this question's resolution.

verification_result.reasoning: Both questions inquire about the introduction of new policies or regulations by Spain to govern the operation of electric vehicle companies like Tesla by 2025. They specify similar conditions for the policy or regulation to be considered valid, including areas such as vehicle sales, charging infrastructure, environmental standards, or operational licensing. Both require official government announcements or credible reports from major news organizations for confirmation. The slight difference in wording ('introduce a new policy' vs. 'implement a new regulation') does not change the essential inquiry, which is whether Spain will have such a policy or regulation in place by the specified date.

P.title: Will Taiwan introduce a new policy to reduce plastic waste by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan has officially introduced a new policy aimed at reducing plastic waste. The policy must be aimed at significantly reducing the production, use, or disposal of plastic materials across the country. This includes, but is not limited to, bans on certain types of single-use plastics, incentives for recycling, or regulations that mandate reductions in plastic packaging. The introduction of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. Temporary measures or policies with limited scope (e.g., specific to certain cities or regions) do not count towards this question's resolution unless they are explicitly part of a national strategy to reduce plastic waste.

para_P.title: Will Taiwan implement a new regulation to cut down on plastic waste by 2025?
para_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan has officially implemented a new regulation aimed at cutting down on plastic waste. The regulation must be aimed at significantly reducing the production, use, or disposal of plastic materials across the country. This includes, but is not limited to, bans on certain types of single-use plastics, incentives for recycling, or regulations that mandate reductions in plastic packaging. The implementation of the regulation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The regulation must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. Temporary measures or regulations with limited scope (e.g., specific to certain cities or regions) do not count towards this question's resolution unless they are explicitly part of a national strategy to cut down on plastic waste.

The terms 'policy' and 'regulation' are used interchangeably in this context, and both questions specify that the measure must be aimed at significantly reducing plastic waste across the country, confirmed by official announcements or credible reports. The conditions for resolution are identical in both questions, making them paraphrases of each other.

P.title: Will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly. Significant fluctuation is defined as a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

para_P.title: Will the incorporation of AI into financial systems lead to substantial fluctuations in the value of the US dollar by 2030?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if, by December 31, 2030, the incorporation of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has led to substantial fluctuations in the value of the US dollar. Substantial fluctuation is defined as a change exceeding 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly linked to the incorporation of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

P.title: Will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly. Significant fluctuation is defined as a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

verification_result.reasoning: Both questions inquire about the impact of AI integration/incorporation into financial systems on the value of the US dollar by 2030. They define 'significant/substantial fluctuation' in the same way (a change of more than 10% against a basket of major currencies within a single calendar year) and require similar forms of confirmation (statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from major financial news organizations, or a consensus among economic experts). Despite slight differences in wording ('integration' vs. 'incorporation' and 'cause' vs. 'lead to'), the essential inquiry and criteria for resolution are the same.

P.title: Will a major political figure propose a global summit on virology research funding before 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major political figure has officially proposed a global summit focused on virology research funding. A "major political figure" is defined as a current head of state, head of government, or a minister of health from any of the G20 nations. The proposal must be for a summit specifically aimed at discussing, planning, or increasing funding for virology research on a global scale. The proposal must be publicly documented through an official government press release, announcement, or in statements made during official government proceedings. In the absence of direct government documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The summit does not need to take place by the resolution date; only the proposal is necessary for the question to resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will a prominent political leader call for an international summit on funding virology research before 2025?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a prominent political leader has formally called for an international summit focused on funding virology research. A "prominent political leader" is defined as a current head of state, head of government, or a minister of health from any of the G20 countries. The call must be for a summit specifically aimed at discussing, planning, or increasing funding for virology research on a global level. The call must be publicly documented through an official government press release, announcement, or in statements made during official government proceedings. In the absence of direct government documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The summit does not need to occur by the resolution date; only the call for the summit is necessary for the question to be answered with Yes.

P.title: Will a major political figure propose a global summit on virology research funding before 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major political figure has officially proposed a global summit focused on virology research funding. A "major political figure" is defined as a current head of state, head of government, or a minister of health from any of the G20 nations. The proposal must be for a summit specifically aimed at discussing, planning, or increasing funding for virology research on a global scale. The proposal must be publicly documented through an official government press release, announcement, or in statements made during official government proceedings. In the absence of direct government documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The summit does not need to take place by the resolution date; only the proposal is necessary for the question to resolve as Yes.

verification_result.reasoning: Both questions inquire about the same event: a major or prominent political figure proposing or calling for a global or international summit on virology research funding before 2025. The definitions of "major political figure" and "prominent political leader" are identical, as are the conditions for the proposal or call to be considered valid. The slight differences in wording ("propose" vs. "call for" and "global" vs. "international") do not change the essential meaning of the questions. Therefore, they are paraphrases of each other.
